Key Arguments: The proposed bill limits the fundamental human right of expression.
The legislation would hinder the open and free exchange of ideas, which is essential for societal progress.
The government's attempt to determine truth through a panel or body is inappropriate and oversteps its purpose.
The bill exempts the government from the same rules, indicating cowardice and unfitness to govern.
Notable Quotes: The open and free exchange of ideas and the exchange of dialogue is what has always driven civilisation forward.
This attempt by a government to insert a panel or body that would determine what is truth is wholly inappropriate and oversteps the boundaries of the governments intended purpose.
